introduction: In this episode of the backend engineering show, the host discusses distributed hashing and its problems, as well as the concept of consistent hashing and its potential solutions. The episode covers the basics of hashing, the limitations of traditional hashing in a distributed system, and the benefits and drawbacks of consistent hashing. The host also touches on the importance of redundancy and replication in distributed systems.

sections.title: Section 1: Introduction to Hashing
content: Explanation of hashing and its use in data storage and retrieval
Discussion of the array position-based hashing approach and its limitations

sections.title: Section 2: Traditional Hashing in a Distributed System
content: Explanation of the limitations of traditional hashing in a distributed system
Discussion of the problems caused by resizing a hash table
Example of a distributed system with four servers
topics: Traditional hashing in a distributed system

sections.title: Section 3: Consistent Hashing
content: Explanation of consistent hashing and its benefits
Discussion of the ring-based approach to consistent hashing
Example of a consistent hashing system with a ring
topics: Example of a consistent hashing system

sections.title: Section 4: Redundancy and Replication in Distributed Systems
content: Explanation of the importance of redundancy and replication in distributed systems
Discussion of the need for backup servers
Example of a backup scenario in a distributed system

sections.title: Section 5: Conclusion
content: Summary of the main points covered in the episode
Discussion of the potential limitations of consistent hashing
Final thoughts on the importance of consistent hashing
